Crimes.Legal_Issue: Whether the Board erred in assessing credibility regarding alleged rape and fear of persecution
Crimes.Credibility_Assessment: Doubted due to delays in reporting and inconsistencies in narrative
Crimes.Evidence_Type: Medical evidence related to mental health (DID), applicant's testimony
Crimes.Legal_Provision: Subsection 72(1) of the Immigration and Refugee Protection Act
Crimes.Basis_of_Claim: Fear of persecution based on alleged rape by a police officer
Crimes.Key_Factor_in_Determination: Inconsistencies in narrative and delayed reporting
Crimes.Review_Outcome: No legal error found; decision upheld
Crimes.Assessment_Standard: Reasonableness, focusing on justification, transparency, and intelligibility
Crimes.Evidence_Ignored: None formally ignored; medical evidence considered but deemed insufficient
Crimes.Application_Factor: Mental health condition (DID) offered as explanation for inconsistencies
Crimes.Decision_Outcome: Negative credibility finding; refugee claim denied
Crimes.Cause_of_Refusal: Lack of credible evidence supporting central allegation of rape
Crimes.Evidentiary_Issues: Inconsistencies in testimony and delayed disclosure
Crimes.Procedural_Fairness: Board provided transparent and intelligible reasoning
Crimes.Legal_Defense_or_Challenge: Applicant argued mental health explained discrepancies
Crimes.Procedural_Issue: Timeliness and consistency of claims in refugee proceedings

Crimes.Legal_Procedure: Refugee appeal and federal court review
Crimes.Government_Body_Involved: Immigration and Refugee Board of Canada

Crimes.Crime_Name: Breach of Trust by Peace Officer
Crimes.Dispute_Type: Credibility assessment regarding abuse of power by police officer
Crimes.Legal_Issue: Whether the Board reasonably assessed credibility of allegations against a peace officer
Crimes.Evidence_Assessment: Medical evidence considered but not dispositive
Crimes.Burden_of_Proof: On applicant to prove well-founded fear
Crimes.Procedural_Issue: Adequacy of reasons and consideration of evidence

Crimes.Procedural_Fairness_Assessment: Board provided transparent and justified decision
Crimes.Applicant_Challenge: Board failed to properly consider mental health impact on testimony
Crimes.Legal_Rule_Source: IRPA and case law on reasonableness
Crimes.Remedy_Requested: Leave for judicial review, setting aside of decision
Crimes.Remedy_Sought: Overturning of Board's negative credibility finding
Crimes.Grounds_for_Inadmissibility_or_Allegatio: Alleged breach of trust by state actor

Crimes.Legal_Issue: Whether the applicant committed perjury by providing false testimony about rape
Crimes.Governing_Law: Criminal Code, Immigration and Refugee Protection Act
Crimes.Application_Facts: Inconsistent details in testimony about alleged rape by police officer
Crimes.Defendant_Behavior: Provided inconsistent statements about traumatic event
Crimes.Grounds_for_Claim: Allegation of rape forming basis of refugee claim
Crimes.Legal_Standard: Perjury requires knowing falsehood under oath
Crimes.Assessment_Factor: Credibility of testimony and presence of mental health condition
Crimes.Procedural_Issue: Use of credibility findings without formal perjury charge
Crimes.Credibility_Assessment: Doubted but not found intentionally false
Crimes.Application_Basis: Refugee claim based on sexual violence
Crimes.Evidence_Assessed: Narrative consistency, timing of disclosures, medical explanations
Crimes.Governing_Rule: Perjury requires proof beyond reasonable doubt of intentional falsehood
Crimes.Evidentiary_Deficiency: Lack of proof of intent to deceive
Crimes.Harm_Assessment: Potential harm from deportation to country of origin
Crimes.Cause_Description: Refugee claim centered on unproven allegation of rape
Crimes.Evidence_Handling: Medical evidence considered but not determinative
Crimes.Evidence_Issues: Inconsistencies attributed to trauma rather than deceit
Crimes.Misrepresentation_Element: Potential misrepresentation due to implausible testimony
Crimes.Jurisdictional_Issue: Interaction between criminal law and immigration credibility
Crimes.Evidentiary_Issues: Reliability of memory and expression under trauma
Crimes.Legal_Standard_Applied: Reasonableness in administrative context; higher burden for perjury
